description: Finished in polished walnut with deep blued metal, an octagonal barrel, and an under-slung 6-round magazine tube, this hunting carbine is but a representative of many such trail arms produced for aspiring huntsmen.  Chambered for the .30 Winchester Centre-Fire cartridge, the firearm renders good work whether within the forests of the east coast, the southern planes, or the tundra of your current destitution.

variants.description: A hunting repeater of New England persuasion, this quaint firearm is finished with a hard walnut buttstock and forend, strong lever-actuated action, and an octagonal-cut barrel bored for .30-30 Centre Fire.  The Browning lineage's brainchild and the first of Winchester’s products to embrace smokeless powder cartridges, many a pig has grown acquainted with this American icon’s bite.  Hopefully, it proves its muster in the Alaskan Islands as proficiently as within the east coast’s woodlands.

//: A magazine tube for a .30 WCF gun with a 20-inch barrel can only hold 6 cartridges, but we’re assuming that, on the 7th bullet, the player's topping up the tube after chambering a round.
